text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

The SCM Directive is applicable to all IT Organizations, contractors, and other stakeholders having responsibility for service offerings and requesting any changes to the Enterprise IT Service Catalog.

Management Directive

) This document describes the formal Information Technology (IT) policy for implementing the requirements of the Service Catalog Management (SCM) and process. It provides the purpose, scope, authority, and mandates for alizing this process. (

) In our IT process environment, there were multiple unstructured entry process silos within and across the organizations, individual processes with inconsistent or incomplete documentation, and lack of standardization in opment of this documentation. This resulted in confusion, inconsistent delivery, process overlaps and inefficiencies, and fewer opportunities to existing processes. The SCM process has been established to address issues. (

) The purpose of SCM is to standardize processes and procedures for maintaining and managing the Enterprise Information Technology (IT) Catalog. The Service Catalog is a list of services with information about all erational IT services, including those available for deployment. The Service Catalog is the part of the Service Portfolio published to our Customers and used to support delivery of IT Services. The Service Catalog includes tion about deliverables, contact points, ordering and the request process. (

) The SCM process will be supported by the Knowledge Incident Service and Asset Management (KISAM) Service Management tool. The Enterprise IT Service Catalog list of services will be managed by this process and stored the KISAM SCM module. (

) The scope of this directive is applicable to all IT service owners involved in lifecycle activities for the introduction of a new service offering, change to existing service and the retirement of a service, in the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) production environment. The SCM Process Manager will nate with each ACIO organization to ensure only operational services are entered in the Enterprise IT Service Catalog. (

) User and Network Services (UNS), Service Planning and Improvement Service Level Management (SLM) is responsible for the development, mentation, and maintenance, of this directive. Approval of this directive, including updates, rests with the SCM Process Owner and UNS. All changes to this directive must be submitted to UNS, SPI, SLM. (

) The SCM process will: • Develop, publish and maintain an Enterprise IT Service Catalog that compasses a list of all operational IT services being provided by the organization • Monitor, measure and report on the Enterprise IT Service Catalog tiveness and instigate corrective measures whenever appropriate • Provide and improve the relationship and communication with the business and customers in conjunction with business relationship agement • Align IT services to the business needs (

Service Catalog Management Directive

The purpose of SCM is to standardize processes and procedures for updating, maintaining and managing the Enterprise Information Technology (IT) Service Catalog. The Service Catalog is a list of services with information about all op- erational IT services, including those available for deployment. The Service Catalog is the part of the Service Portfolio published to our Customers and used to support delivery of IT Services. The Service Catalog includes informa- tion about deliverables, contact points, ordering and the request process.

Develop, publish and maintain an Enterprise IT Service Catalog that compasses a list of all operational IT services being provided by the IT organization Monitor, measure and report on the Enterprise IT Service Catalog tiveness and instigate corrective measures whenever appropriate Provide and improve the relationship and communication with the business and customers in conjunction with business relationship man
agement Align IT services to the business needs
2.142 Service Catalog Management
that SCM directives, policies and procedures are aligned with Service Level Management (SLM) and Service Portfolio Manage- (SPM) directives, processes and procedures.
